> "No records of this Transformer, eh? I believe that there may still
be." She 
> paced a moment, then stopped & rested her clawed paw/hands upon her
hips. 
> "The only Master of Cybertron, is Megatron! Conquerer of all of
Cybertron."
> 
> She turned around. "As to my older form being fleeting, we shall see
about 
> that. You forget, if this is of a different age, my own knowledge is
of a 
> different age as well." shifting to a more deadly tone. "I know not
who you 
> are, or of the others you speak of, but I am a Decepticon. My
loyality is to 
> Megatron & his wishes."
> 
> "Now... must I tear apart this world in search of what I need alone?
Or will 
> I gain cooperation? It's not good to be against me, rest assured you
say the 
> same that I should not betray you. But.. how many Transformers do
you know 
> who have survived since the time of the Great War? Hmm?" Her optics
were icy 
> but a slight old glint was in them. She had many ideas. In her
'mind' she 
> still had skematics of her old form. The form that was an upgrade by 
> Scrapper. She enjoyed this one the best.

Belthassan's reply to her stare was equally cold. It was getting
obvious he didn't like her.

Belthassan: Oh? Then let me update history. The Great Wars are over.
Megatron and Optimus Prime are both dead. Your time is gone. You said
it yourself: no other Decepticon made it to this age... at least, not
without the upgrade to Maximal or Predacon. Thus, I say that the likes
of you are dead. Now shut up, listen, watch and learn.

He stood up and went close to an old wire cable sticking out of the
ground. It was old but still strong and big.

Belthassan: Melchana, please make it so we can show what we're able to do.

The lioness came near and, in one movement of her arms, slashed the
wire in three pieces. She threw them all in the air.

Belthassan shot a freezing ray of ice at one piece and punched it with
a huge fist, shattering it in dozens of pieces.

Melchana aimed at one with both arms at fired a hail of sandy
particles which eroded to piece to nothing in moments.

Gesper lashed out with his tail and ensnared the last piece. It seemed
to do nothing but there soon was a crackling of static and the smell
of something burning. When he let go, the fried wires fell smoking to
the ground.

Belthassan: That is only a fraction of what we can do. Once you can
transform, you'll be able to use it too. Now the question is the same
one our first ancestors asked each other: Friend or Foe?
